alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 8:11PM CDT until July 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect the Cimarron River to reach bankfull levels through Payne County. Small areas of agricultural land and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet early Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Monday morning at 815 AM CDT.
